metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1919 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Codecs in Google Chrome prior to 101.0.4951.41 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
